Detailed Description

SMBGatewaySession is a utility class for the SMB implementation of the authentication server. It enables the developer to create, check, and end an SMB authentication session without making direct HTTP calls.

It is included in this package for use by existing Blu-Ice code and other web applications. It should not be used for non-SMB development. Use AuthGatewayBean instead.

Author:
Kenneth Sharp
Version:
3.0 (released September 15, 2005)

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

edu.stanford.slac.ssrl.authentication.utility.SMBGatewaySession.SMBGatewaySession (  String  SMBSessionID,
String  appName
) 
 

Constructor to create an object based on an existing session.

This version of the constructor looks for the servlet host in the java system property authgateway.host

Parameters:
String SessionID is the existing session's id
String appName is the application instantiating this bean.

String  appName,
String  sHost
) 
 

Constructor based on an existing session.

Parameters:
String SessionID is the existing session's id
String appName is the application instantiating this bean.
String sHost is such as http://smb.slac.stanford.edu where authentication is running.

edu.stanford.slac.ssrl.authentication.utility.SMBGatewaySession.SMBGatewaySession (  String  appName,
String  userid,
String  password,
String  sHost,
int  sessionTimeout
) 
 

Constructor to create a new session.

Parameters:
String appName is the application instantiating this bean.
String userid is the user to be authenticated (in clear text)
String password is the user's password (in clear text)
String sHost is such as http://smb.slac.stanford.edu where authentication is running.
int sessionTimeout is the inactive session timeout in seconds

boolean edu.stanford.slac.ssrl.authentication.utility.SMBGatewaySession.updateSessionData (  boolean  recheckDatabase  ) 
 

Updates the session data by calling the SessionStatus servlet. Also rechecks the database for beamline access if the recheckDatabase parameter is true.

Parameters:
boolean recheckDatabase forces a recheck of beamline access if true.
Returns:
true if the update is performed successfully. returns false</otherwise>.
